column1: What did the failing kidney say to the healthy one? urine charge now.
column3: The word urine can refer to the bodily fluid and is a play on the phrase Youre in.
column4: The doctor informed the patient that his urine sample came back clean.
column5: When youre in the zone, everything seems to flow perfectly.

column1: What do you call a vampire that sucks mucus instead of blood? nose-feratu!
column3: The word nose refers to a part of the face and also can imply the act of knowing or perceiving.
column4: She used her nose to detect the faint scent of flowers in the air.
column5: He has a great nose for news, always finding interesting stories.

column1: What did one earthquake say to the other? .... .... was that your fault or mine?
column3: The word fault can mean a geological fault line and also refers to responsibility for a mistake.
column4: Scientists studied the fault to assess the risk of earthquakes in the area.
column5: It was his fault that the project was delayed due to poor planning.
